rules.text: Livestock must be confined and baseline manure streams must be anaerobic without methane recovery.
Residual waste must be handled aerobically and all biogas must be captured or flared.
Apply alternative methodologies when landfill, wastewater or co-digestion activities occur.
Respect the 60 kt CO2e/year small-scale cap and SSC general guidelines for lifetime and capacity additions.
Additionality is satisfied if no regulation requires methane capture; otherwise apply SSC additionality guidelines.
Include livestock facilities, manure handling, centralized digesters, biogas utilization and transport within the project boundary.
Baseline methane emissions follow ACM0010/AM0073 factors using VS or COD data and methane conversion factors.
Project emissions use the anaerobic digester, flaring, fossil fuel and electricity tools.
Account for leakage from manure transport, digestate handling and suppressed baseline uses.
Monitor all parameters listed in Table 5.1 with calibrated instruments and maintain 95/10 precision when sampling.
